item.title: Report E-2024090203
item.description:
Report E-2024090203

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: WESTAMPTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When loading freight into trailer, material handler discovered a jerrican that was slightly leaking from bottom. Further investigation discovered that a nail protruding from the pallet the jerrican was staged on by shipper had slightly punctured the bottom of the jerrican contributing to the unintentional release. The spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured jerrican.

item.title: Report E-2024090199
item.description:
Report E-2024090199

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-23
  • City: WESTAMPTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WHILE UNLOADING TRAILER, MATERIAL HANDLER DISCOVERED A JERRICAN THAT HAD LEAKED OUT IT'S CONTENTS ONTO THE TRAILER FLOOR. FURTHER INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT A NAIL PROTRUDING FROM THE PALLET THE SHIPPER STAGED THE JERRICAN ON FOR TRANSPORT HAD PUNCTURED THE BOTTOM OF THE JERRICAN CONTRIBUTING TO THE UNINTENTIONAL RELEASE. SPILLED MATERIAL WAS NEUTRALIZED AND CLEANED WITH ABSORBENTS AND PLACED IN TO A RECOVERY CONTAINER AS WAS THE PUNCTURED JERRICAN.

item.title: Report E-2024090166
item.description:
Report E-2024090166

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-20
  • City: WESTAMPTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered a jerrican that had leaked the majority of it's contents. Further investigation revealed that a nail on the pallet the jerrican was staged on had slightly punctured the bottom of the jerrican consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured jerrican.

item.title: Report X-2024090627
item.description:
Report X-2024090627

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-12T09:14:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-30
  • City: EDISON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THREE AIR PACKAGES WERE DISCOVERED NEEDING A PACKAGE REWRAP. DURING PACKAGE INSPECTION WE FOUND EACH PACKAGE TO CONTAIN 3"CHLORINE TABLETS IN 25 POUND BUCKETS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE THREE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOXES TO INDICATE DANGEROUS GOODS WERE BEING SHIPPED. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS ARE 1Z7R16Y30133425499 AND 1Z7R16Y30179867346. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT 7R16Y3, INDY BULK RATE GROUND, 5425 EXPLORATION DRIVE, SUITE 1, INDIANAPOLIS IN 46241.

item.title: Report X-2024090577
item.description:
Report X-2024090577

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-12T09:14:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: SECAUCUS
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS NEAR HAZMAT AUDITOR CAGE, UPON INSPECTION PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND FOUND TO BE IN HMMS AS A HAZMAT DESPITE BOX HAVING NO HAZMARKS, LABELS OR INSTRUCTIONS. SPILL WAS CLEANED UP AND BROUGHT TO DMP CAGE WHERE FURTHER INVESTIGATION SAW THAT PACKAGE HAD AN HMMS ENTRY AND WAS 4 BOTTLES OF ECO LAB STAINBLASTER MAKEUP REMOVER.

item.description:
Report E-2024090130

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1-gallon of Hexahydrohexamethylindenopryan released from one 55-gallon drum due to it rubbing on the strap during transit causing some product to release. The release impacted inside trailer#321-4112. Terminal personnel had already clean the release. The recovered material was placed into a 65-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024090335
item.description:
Report X-2024090335

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-10T09:23:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-03
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UPON INSPECTION IF PACKAGE IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE hazardous materials certification DID NOT HAVE THE PACKAGE LISTED ON THE PAPERWORK. ALSO, THE PACKAGE WAS NOT SHIPPMENT USING HAZMAT SERVICE CODE FOR UN1689 Sodium cyanide, solid. THE SHIPPER WOULD NOT PICK UP THE PACKAGE FROM THE TERMINAL. THERE IS NO VISIBLE DAMAGE TO THE OUTER PACKAGING. FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR UNDAMAGED PACKAGE MISSING THE CORRECT HAZMAT DOCUMENTS AND AWAITING DISPOSTION FROM PGH.

item.title: Report E-2024090106
item.description:
Report E-2024090106

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-15

  • State: NJ

  • Description: Approximately 20 gallons of product leaked from GT tractor pump. Tractor pump suffered Cracked flex transfer pipe under hydrapack cover. Confirmed by National Tank Services.
